definition: retention sample/(of a manufacturer, esp. of food or drugs) to retain a sample of a batch of a product (abbr. for 保留樣品|保留样品[bao3 liu2 yang4 pin3])
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: Samples which cannot be stored easily shall be kept for a period determined in accordance with the circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 不易贮存的留样，可根据实际情况掌握保存时间。

sentences.english: For those difficult to preserve, the preservation period shall depend on the actual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 不易贮存的留样，可根据实际情况掌握保存时间。

sentences.english: Retained samples can be tested to obtain data to retrospectively validate the process.
sentences.chinese: 可用测试留样来获取回顾性工艺验证数据。

sentences.english: In charge of the raw material sample for each lot number .
sentences.chinese: 负责原材料的每批次的接收和留样。

sentences.english: How do you keep your retention samples of raw materials and finished products?
sentences.chinese: 您怎样保存原料和成品的留样？

sentences.english: Retained Samples must be maintained in accordance with local Procedure and Global Quality Standards.
sentences.chinese: 留样的保存必须符合地方法规和全球质量标准的规定。

sentences.english: Develop sampling and sample keeping system.
The retained sample observation test has shown that this preparation is currently stable.
sentences.chinese: 留样观察试验表明，该制剂初步稳定。

sentences.english: The management of retention samples is an important part in institute for drug control.
sentences.chinese: 检品留样管理是实验室管理的重要组成部分。

definition: separate meals/to eat individual meals (rather than taking one's food from plates served to everyone at the table)
to test a random sample/to spot-check
random inspection/to do a spot check
